title: Chuffed
content:
Originating in this post: [http://www.typophile.com/node/40466](http://web.archive.org/web/20141110022654/http:/www.typophile.com/node/40466 "http://www.typophile.com/node/40466")

[Chuffed](http://web.archive.org/web/20141110022654/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Chuffed) (_adj_): Quite pleased.

In [Typophile](http://web.archive.org/web/20141110022654/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Typophile) [Terminology](http://web.archive.org/web/20141110022654/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Terminology); it's rather the opposite of [Squoosh](http://web.archive.org/web/20141110022654/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Squoosh) as coined by [Miss Tiffany](http://web.archive.org/web/20141110022654/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Miss%20Tiffany).

As the orginal post also illustrates, less useful terminology has also been developed, based loosely around the lesser Chuff (_intransitive verb_): to produce noisy exhaust or exhalations : proceed or operate with chuffs
author: AndrewSipe
